intro: Calceolaria dentata var. subincisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and thrives in cool, humid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. Calceolaria dentata var. subincisa is also noted for its preference for well-drained soil and partial shade.
